Function# IOMapperInsertPage

macOS 10.2+

```
ppnum_t IOMapperInsertPage(ppnum_t addr, unsigned int offset, ppnum_t page);
```

## [See Also](/documentation/kernel/1532970-iomapperinsertpage#see-also)

### [Mapped Memory](/documentation/kernel/1532970-iomapperinsertpage#mapped-memory)

[`IOMapper`](/documentation/kernel/iomapper)[`IOMemoryMap`](/documentation/kernel/iomemorymap)A class defining common methods for describing a memory mapping.[`IOMappedRead16`](/documentation/kernel/1575322-iomappedread16)Read two bytes from the desired "Physical" IOSpace address.[`IOMappedRead32`](/documentation/kernel/1575311-iomappedread32)Read four bytes from the desired "Physical" IOSpace address.[`IOMappedRead64`](/documentation/kernel/1575301-iomappedread64)Read eight bytes from the desired "Physical" IOSpace address.[`IOMappedRead8`](/documentation/kernel/1575317-iomappedread8)Read one byte from the desired "Physical" IOSpace address.[`IOMappedWrite16`](/documentation/kernel/1575315-iomappedwrite16)Write two bytes to the desired "Physical" IOSpace address.[`IOMappedWrite32`](/documentation/kernel/1575310-iomappedwrite32)Write four bytes to the desired "Physical" IOSpace address.[`IOMappedWrite64`](/documentation/kernel/1575313-iomappedwrite64)Write eight bytes to the desired "Physical" IOSpace address.[`IOMappedWrite8`](/documentation/kernel/1575318-iomappedwrite8)Write one byte to the desired "Physical" IOSpace address.[`IOMapperIOVMAlloc`](/documentation/kernel/1532986-iomapperiovmalloc)[`IOMapperIOVMFree`](/documentation/kernel/1532978-iomapperiovmfree)[`IOFlushProcessorCache`](/documentation/kernel/1575308-ioflushprocessorcache)Flushes the processor cache for mapped memory.
